info.presets_1: The AutoFarm use presets to send attacks, you have to select one preset in the selection tab.
info.presets_2: No need to activate the presets in every village.
info.presets_3: Only the units specified in preset will be used, officers will be ignored.
info.presets_4: It is possible to change the amount of the troops while the Auto Farm is active.
info.presets_5: It is possible to have more than one preset, since it has the same name. The script will send the first preset from the list. If the village dosen't have enough troops, the script will select the next preset.
info.ignore_1: You can select a ignoring group from Presets Settings, all villages that assigned in that group will be ignored by the script. The group works on targets and your own villages as well.
info.include_1: As well as ignoring villages, you can include village targets of players. All villages out of maximum distance will be ignored.
info.randomBase_1: That interval is a random period of time between each attack avoid the script to be detected by the game. The bigger the better.
info.selected_1: With this option activated, only the village that has already selected will be used to send attacks, blocking the script to select other villages.
info.selected_2: Even if you select another village, the attacks will keep sending from the same village. Unless you pause the script and start it again.
info.development_by: AutoFarm is developed with ‚ù§ by

tasklogs.noUnitsNoCommands: No villages has units or commands returning.
tasklogs.noVillages: No villages avaliable, waiting attacks return.
tasklogs.commandLimit: Limit of 50 attacks reached, waiting return.
tasklogs.noUnits: No units avaliable in village, waiting attacks return.
